009package Ch21_GeometricOperations;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.LinearMapping2D;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
018import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
019import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.image.ImageMapper;
021import imagingbook.common.image.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
022import imagingbook.common.image.interpolation.InterpolationMethod;
023import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
024import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
025
026/**
027 * <p>
028 * This plugin demonstrates the use of geometric mappings, as implemented in the
029 * imagingbook library. A {@link ProjectiveMapping2D} (transformation) is
030 * specified by 4 corresponding point pairs, given by point sequences P and Q.
031 * The inverse mapping is required for target-to-source mapping. See Sec. 21.1.4
032 * of [1] for details. The actual pixel transformation is performed by an
033 * {@link ImageMapper} object. Try on a suitable test image and check if the
034 * image corners (P) are mapped to the points specified in Q. This plugin works
035 * for all image types. The transformed image is shown in a new window, the
036 * original image remains unchanged. Optionally opens a sample image if no image
037 * is currently open.
038 * </p>
039 * <p>
040 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
041 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
042 * </p>
043 * 
044 * @author WB
045 * @version 2022/11/28
046 *
047 * @see LinearMapping2D
048 * @see ProjectiveMapping2D
049 * @see ImageMapper
050 */
051public class Map_Linear_Projective implements PlugInFilter {
052        
053        private static Pnt2d[] P = {            // source quad
054                        Pnt2d.from(0, 0),
055                        Pnt2d.from(400, 0),
056                        Pnt2d.from(400, 400),
057                        Pnt2d.from(0, 400)};
058
059        private static Pnt2d[] Q = {            // target quad
060                        Pnt2d.from(0, 60),
061                        Pnt2d.from(400, 20),
062                        Pnt2d.from(300, 400),
063                        Pnt2d.from(30, 200)};
064
065        private ImagePlus im;
066        
067        /**
068         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
069         * is currently open.
070         */
071        public Map_Linear_Projective() {
072                if (IjUtils.noCurrentImage()) {
073                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Kepler);
074                }
075        }
076        
077        @Override
078        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
079                this.im = im;
080                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;
081        }
082
083        @Override
084        public void run(ImageProcessor source) {
085                int W = source.getWidth();
086                int H = source.getHeight();
087                
088                // create the target image:
089                ImageProcessor target = source.createProcessor(W, H); 
090                
091                // create the target-to source mapping, i.e. Q -> P. 
092                // there are 2 alternatives:
093                LinearMapping2D m = ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(P, Q);               // P -> Q, then invert
094                LinearMapping2D mi = m.getInverse();            
095                //Mapping2D mi = ProjectiveMapping2D.fromPoints(Q, P);  // Q -> P = inverse mapping
096
097                // create a mapper instance:
098                ImageMapper mapper = 
099                                new ImageMapper(mi, OutOfBoundsStrategy.ZeroValues, InterpolationMethod.Bicubic);
100                
101                // apply the mapper:
102                mapper.map(source, target);
103                
104                // display the target image:
105                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-transformed", target).show();
106                
107                IJ.log("A = \n" + Matrix.toString(m.getTransformationMatrix()));
108        }
109}
